SubjectFinancial Consumer Protection Framework Regulations
PrecisFINANCIAL CONSUMER PROTECTION FRAMEWORK REGULATIONS in order to (1) streamline and consolidate requirements on banks and authorize foreign banks that are currently found in 23 different existing regulations; and (2) introduce new requirements that will i) support access to basic banking via requirements to help ensure Canadians who rely on Government of Canada payments for their basic income are able to cash cheques they may receive, free of charge, even if they are not a customer of a bank, ii) improve the timeliness of banks' complaint-handling process, iii) clarify the scope of the legislative framework so that it applies as intended, iv) update disclosure requirements which help consumers understand their rights and obligations with respect to liability for unauthorized credit card transactions, and v) set new disclosure requirements to help ensure consumers can obtain the most up-to-date interest rate for deposit type instruments at renewal.
